cz.pscheidl.randomOrg

Class RandomOrg

  • java.lang.Object
    • cz.pscheidl.randomOrg.RandomOrg

  • public class RandomOrg
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows you to use free Random.Org number generator services. Credit goes to www.random.org
    This version was released @ May 06 2012
    Version:
    1.5
    Author:
    Pavel Pscheidl

    • Method Detail

      • getSingleRandomInt

        public int getSingleRandomInt(int min,
                     int max)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns single integer generated by Random.org within specified limits - base 10.
        Parameters:
        min - Lower limit - int.
        max - Upper limit - int.
        Returns:
        Single integer number - base 10.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When Random.org gives no response, this exception takes place.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Upper limit must be always greater than lower limit.

      • getSingleRandomInt

        public int getSingleRandomInt(int min,
                     int max,
                     short base)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns single integer generated by Random.org within specified limits - all bases.
        Parameters:
        min - Lower limit base 10 - int
        max - Upper limit base 10 - int.
        Returns:
        Single integer number - all bases.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When Random.org gives no response, this exception takes place.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Upper limit must be always greater than lower limit. Base must be BINARY, OCTAL, DECIMAL or HEX.

      • getSingleRandomInt

        public int getSingleRandomInt(int value)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Generates single random integer from given value to 0. If negative value is passed, this method returns negative numbers from given negative value to 0;
        Parameters:
        value - Limit value.
        Returns:
        Single random number from 0 to given value.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When Random.org gives no response, this exception takes place.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When zero is passed as an argument.

      • getRandomInt

        public int[] getRandomInt(int min,
                 int max,
                 int howMany)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns array of integers generated by Random.org within specified limits.
        Parameters:
        min - Lower limit - int;
        max - Upper limit - int;
        howMany - How many numbers do you want to get ? - int
        Returns:
        Returns int[] of obtained values
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When Random.org gives no response, this exception takes place.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Upper limit must be always greater than lower limit. You also want to get at least 1 integer, not less.

      • getRandomInt

        public int[] getRandomInt(int value,
                 int howMany)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns array of integers generated by Random.org from 0 to specified limit.
        PLEASE NOTE: Since Random.org returns negative numbers aswell, this method, unlike other random API's, accepts negative "value" argument.
        Parameters:
        value - Limit value.
        howMany - How many integers do you want ?
        Returns:
        array of random integers int[]
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When Random.org gives no response, this exception takes place.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If 0 is passed as an argument.

      • getRandomInt

        public int[] getRandomInt(int min,
                 int max,
                 int howMany,
                 short base)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns array of integers generated by Random.org within specified limit. You can specify base with prepared constants.
        PLEASE NOTE: Random.org doesn't work well with negative numbers in OCTAL, HEXADECIMAL or BINARY base. For these bases, only numbers >= 0 are allowed.
        Parameters:
        min - Lower limit - in decimal base.
        max - - Upper limit - in decimal base.
        howMany - - How many integers do you want ?
        base - Base you want your output in. BINARY, OCTAL, DECIMAL and HEXADECIMAL are allowed.
        Returns:
        array of random integers - int[]
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When Random.org gives no response, this exception takes place.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Min must be greater than max, numbers of integers must be greater than 0, base must be in bounds.

      • getIntByTotalValue

        public int[] getIntByTotalValue(int min,
                       int max,
                       int totalValue)
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Optimized algorithm to easily obtain random numbers within selected limits of given total value. Keeps Random.Org server load on minimum, yet all numbers are truly random.

        Requests are sent in as large groups as possible, but final number of requests is also random and depends on Random.Org server behavior.
        Parameters:
        min - Lower limit - int;
        max - Upper limit - int.
        totalValue - Total value all integers put together represent.
        Returns:
        Array of ints containing obtained numbers.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When Random.org gives no response, this exception takes place.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Upper limit must be always greater than lower limit. Also, total value must be greater than 0 and larger than maximum value;

      • getSequence

        public int[] getSequence(int min,
                int max)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                         java.io.IOException
        Returns complete random sequence of random integers.
        Parameters:
        min - Lower limit
        max - Upper limit
        Returns:
        int[]
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Maximum amount of generated numbers must NOT exceed 10,000.
        java.io.IOException - When Random.org gives no response, this exception takes place.

      • getSingleRandomString

        public java.lang.String getSingleRandomString(int stringLenght,
                                     boolean digitsOn,
                                     boolean lowerAlphaOn,
                                     boolean upperAlphaOn,
                                     boolean uniqueOn)
                                       throws java.io.IOException,
                                              java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Generates single truly random string based on settings.
        Parameters:
        stringLenght - How long should those strings be ? From 1 to 20.
        digitsOn - Should those Strings contain digits ?
        lowerAlphaOn - Should those strings contain lower Alpha characters ?
        upperAlphaOn - Should those strings contain upper Alpha characters ?
        uniquieOn - Should all strings be unique ?
        Returns:
        String
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When Random.org server can't be reached or when it gives invalid response.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When string lenght is not set between 1 and 20, or none of character types is turned on.

      • getRandomString

        public java.lang.String[] getRandomString(int howMany,
                                 int stringLenght,
                                 boolean digitsOn,
                                 boolean lowerAlphaOn,
                                 boolean upperAlphaOn,
                                 boolean uniquieOn)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                          java.io.IOException
        Generates truly random Strings based on settings.
        Parameters:
        howMany - How many strings do you want ? From 1 to 10,000
        stringLenght - How long should those strings be ? From 1 to 20.
        digitsOn - Should those Strings contain digits ?
        lowerAlphaOn - Should those strings contain lower Alpha characters ?
        upperAlphaOn - Should those strings contain upper Alpha characters ?
        uniquieOn - Should all strings be unique ?
        Returns:
        Array of Strings - String[]
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When number of strings to generate is not between 1 and 10,000, wen string lenght is not set between 1 and 20, or none of character types is turned on.
        java.io.IOException - When Random.org server can't be reached or when it gives invalid response.

      • setCurrentDefaultTimeout

        public void setCurrentDefaultTimeout(int value)
        Sets new default timeout value in milliseconds. Default value is 10000(ten seconds).
        Parameters:
        value - New timeout value in milliseconds.

      • getCurrentDefaultTimeout

        public int getCurrentDefaultTimeout()
        Returns timeout currently set.
        Returns:
        Integer with current timeout value.

      • getLocalQuota

        public int getLocalQuota()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Check for quota remaining for machine request was sent by and returns it.
        Returns:
        Integer value with quota left
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When no connection is established, or Random.Org gives no response, this exception takes place.

      • getRemainingQuota

        public int getRemainingQuota(java.lang.String adress)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Returns remaining quota for given adress.
        Parameters:
        adress - IP Adress
        Returns:
        Integer representing remaining quota.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When no connection is established, or Random.Org gives no response, this exception takes place.
